revisions.rev:
{{cleanup-linkrot|date=August 2011}} {{Infobox artist discography | Artist = [[Deftones]] | Image = Deftones live brixton academy 2007.jpg | Caption = Deftones performing live on April 14, 2007 at the [[Brixton Academy]], [[London]]. Left to right: [[Stephen Carpenter]], [[Chi Cheng (musician)|Chi Cheng]] (fore), [[Frank Delgado (American musician)|Frank Delgado]] (behind), [[Chino Moreno]] and [[Abe Cunningham]]. | Studio = 6 | Live = | Compilation = 3 | Video = | Music videos = 18 | Tribute = | EP = 2 | Singles = 17 | B-sides = 23 | Soundtrack = | 1Option = 1 | 1Option name = Demo albums | 1Option link = Demos | 1Option color = }} The '''discography of Deftones''', a [[Sacramento, California]]-based alternative metal band formed in 1988, consists of six full-length [[studio album]]s, two [[extended play|EP]]s, one [[compilation album]], one [[demo (music)|demo]] and fourteen [[single (music)|singles]]. Their back-catalogue of b-side material encompasses over twenty tracks. One release have been certified "Gold" by the [[RIAA]] in recognition of sales of over 500,000 copies, and three are "Platinum".{{cite web|url=http://www.riaa.com/goldandplatinumdata.php?&artist=Deftones|title=RIAA Database Search Results for Deftones|publisher=[[Recording Industry Association of America]]|accessdate=2007-09-01}} [[Deftones]]' first commercially released album was ''[[Adrenaline (album)|Adrenaline]]'', in 1995. It peaked at number 23 in the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Top Heatseekers]] chart, its success attributable to word-of-mouth and rigorous touring and live performance. 1997's ''[[Around the Fur]]'' was far more successful, peaking at number one on the ''Billboard'' Heatseekers chart, and in 29th position on ''[[Billboard 200]]''. It was also their first international success, entering the British charts for the first time and peaking in 56th position. The album provided their first ever charting singles, "[[My Own Summer (Shove It)]]" and "[[Be Quiet and Drive (Far Away)]]". ''[[White Pony]]'' was released in 2000 to critical acclaim and unprecedented commercial success, peaking in third position in the US. Singles "[[Change (In the House of Flies)]]" and "[[Digital Bath]]" supported the album's release. A single entitled "[[Back to School (Mini Maggit)]]" was released as a rap-influenced reinterpretation of ''White Pony's'' closing track, "Pink Maggit". While commercially successful and a fan favourite, the band have vociferously objected to its publication.{{cite journal |last= Lash |first= Jolie |date= 16 September 2000 |title= The Deftones Add New Single to "White Pony" |url= http://www.rollingstone.com/artists/deftones/articles/story/5925471/the_deftones_add_new_single_to_white_pony |journal= [[Rolling Stone]] |accessdate= 23 December 2007 | archiveurl = http://web.archive.org/web/20090510070709/http://www.rollingstone.com/artists/deftones/articles/story/5925471/the_deftones_add_new_single_to_white_pony | archivedate = 10 May 2009 | deadurl = yes}} ''White Pony'' was subsequently re-released with "Back to School (Mini Maggit)" as the album's opening track. The eponymous ''[[Deftones (album)|Deftones]]'' was released in 2003, charting in second position in the US, and garnering widespread international success. ''[[B-Sides & Rarities (Deftones album)|B-Sides & Rarities]]'' saw release in 2005, bringing together unreleased and obscure material accrued since 1995. 2006's ''[[Saturday Night Wrist]]'', completed after a protracted and tumultuous recording process, reached number ten in the US.{{cite web|title=Deftones: Album & Song Chart History|publisher=''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]''|url=http://www.billboard.com/artist/deftones/chart-history/141369#/artist/deftones/chart-history/141369|accessdate=2007-12-23}} "[[Hole in the Earth]]" charted in eighteenth spot, while "[[Mein (song)|Mein]]" only reached number 40 in [[Mainstream Rock Tracks]]. The band's sixth and latest album, ''[[Diamond Eyes]]'', was released on May 4, 2010. ==Albums== ===Studio albums=== {|class="wikitable" !rowspan="2"|Year !rowspan="2"|Album details !colspan="12"|Peak chart positions !rowspan="2"|Certifications |- !style="width:3em;font-size:75%;"|[[Billboard 200|US]]

===Live versions=== All live tracks from the two "[[My Own Summer (Shove It)]]" singles, respectively, were compiled into a live EP entitled ''[[Deftones (live)|Live]]''{{Citation needed|date=October
